<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENT NO. 3 TO THE RESTATED DEV. AND COM. COLLABORATION AGMT.
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Amendment No. 3 to the Restated Dev. and Com. Collaboration Agmt.</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.13 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">* CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND
EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDMENT NO. 3 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>TO THE </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>RESTATED DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>COLLABORATION AGREEMENT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">THIS AMENDMENT NO. 3 (&#147;Amendment&#148;) to that certain Restated Development and Commercialization Collaboration Agreement dated October&nbsp;23, 2001 (&#147;Restated Agreement&#148;), is made and entered into as of September&nbsp;25,
2006 (&#147;3</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">rd</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> Amendment Effective Date&#148;), by and between Otsuka
Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (&#147;Otsuka&#148;), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Japan, having a principal place of business at 2-9, Kanda Tsukasa-cho, Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo, 101-8535 Japan, and Bristol-Myers Squibb Company
(&#147;BMS&#148;), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Delaware, having a principal place of business at 345 Park Avenue, New York, New York 10154, USA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>RECITALS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Otsuka and BMS have previously entered into the Restated Agreement and an
Amendment No.&nbsp;1 (dated March&nbsp;28, 2003) and an Amendment No.&nbsp;2 (dated June&nbsp;5, 2003) to the Restated Agreement; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS,
Otsuka and BMS now desire to amend certain terms and conditions of the Restated Agreement as hereinafter specified; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Otsuka and
BMS desire that all other terms and conditions of the Restated Agreement, as previously amended, remain in full force and effect; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">NOW,
THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, Otsuka and BMS agree as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">1. Capitalized terms in this Amendment shall have the same meanings as those in the Restated Agreement, unless specifically defined otherwise in this Amendment. All Section references are in regard to the Restated Agreement. References to
the term &#147;Agreement&#148; in the Restated Agreement shall be deemed to include this Amendment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. Except as expressly modified
herein, the Restated Agreement shall remain in full force and effect in accordance with its terms, as previously amended. To the extent that there are any inconsistencies between this Amendment and the Restated Agreement, as previously amended, the
terms of this Amendment shall supersede the Restated Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. In consideration for any exercise by Otsuka of its
rights under Subsection 8.2.2(a) of the Restated Agreement, as amended by this Amendment, BMS hereby agrees to, and shall, pay Otsuka the sum of [*] within ten (10)&nbsp;days after the 3</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">rd</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> Amendment Effective Date. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4. Otsuka and BMS hereby amend and restate Section&nbsp;8.2 of the Restated Agreement in its entirety as
follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2 <U>Patent Infringement by Third Party</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2.1 <U>Notice of Infringement</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If, during the term of this Agreement, either party
becomes aware of any infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement by any third party of any Patent Rights in the Field in the Territory, such party shall promptly give written notice thereof to the other party, with all available
details in its possession. The party involved in any such action or controlling any action under Section&nbsp;8.2.2 or 8.2.3 (the &#147;Active Party&#148;) shall, in each case except as provided to the contrary in Sections 8.2.2 and 8.2.3:
(a)&nbsp;keep the other party (the &#147;Inactive Party&#148;) reasonably informed of the status of the action including, but not limited to, significant developments during the pendency of such action; (b)&nbsp;endeavor to solicit the participation
and views of the Inactive Party during each stage of the action; and (c)&nbsp;reasonably consider such Inactive Party&#146;s views, although the Active Party&#146;s judgment shall control. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2.2. <U>Remedies Against Infringement of Patent Rights in the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>Otsuka&#146;s First Right to Pursue Remedies Against Infringement of Patent Rights in the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) With respect to any infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of any Patent Rights in the Field in the United
States, Otsuka shall have the first right, but not the obligation, to take action, at its expense, to pursue any and all remedies against such infringer to stop such infringement and to recover profits and damages in connection therewith.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Pursuant to such right of Otsuka, in all actions, disputes and proceedings involving Patent Rights in the United
States, Otsuka shall have the sole and exclusive right to control prosecution of such actions, disputes and proceedings (including the right to select counsel in connection therewith) and shall (notwithstanding Section&nbsp;8.2.1) have no obligation
to keep BMS informed regarding any such actions, disputes or proceedings or the prosecution thereof. BMS shall have no right to control, or to participate in, the decision making process with respect to any such actions, disputes or proceedings
involving the enforcement of the Patent Rights in the United States, any infringement, threatened infringement, or suspected infringement of the Patent Rights in the United States, or the settlement or compromise thereof. BMS&#146;s consent to the
settlement or compromise of any such action, dispute or proceeding pertaining to the Patent Rights shall not be required; provided, however, that Otsuka will not enter into any settlement or compromise of any such action, dispute or proceeding that
requires BMS to pay money to a third party or that imposes liability on BMS without BMS&#146;s prior written consent, which BMS shall not unreasonably withhold (such settlement or compromise being referred to in this Section&nbsp;8.2.2 and in
Section&nbsp;8.2.3 as a &#147;Settlement Requiring </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">BMS Consent&#148;). Otsuka shall not be required to inform BMS, or to consult with BMS, in respect of any action, dispute or proceeding, or the settlement or
compromise of any action or dispute, pertaining to the infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of the Patent Rights or the enforcement of the Patent Rights in the United States, except only as and to the extent required above
with respect to a Settlement Requiring BMS Consent. Further, BMS may not join as a party in any such actions, disputes or proceedings. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) BMS shall cooperate with Otsuka as reasonably requested by Otsuka in connection with such action, dispute or proceeding, shall cause any of BMS&#146;s and its Affiliates&#146; employees and agents to give
depositions or testify in connection with any proceeding regarding the Patent Rights in the United States when requested by Otsuka, and shall make available to Otsuka copies of any and all relevant records, papers, documents, information and
specimens. BMS shall bear the out-of-pocket expenses and internal costs incurred by it and its Affiliates in providing such cooperation to Otsuka at Otsuka&#146;s request, in causing such employees and agents to give such depositions or testimony,
and in making available copies of such documents or other materials. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) In the event of any monetary recovery by Otsuka
in connection with any such action, dispute or proceeding in the United States involving the Patent Rights in the Field, or the settlement or compromise thereof, such recovery shall be entirely retained by Otsuka for its own account and benefit.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) In the event that any adverse judgment for monetary liability is imposed on either Otsuka or any of its Affiliates in
favor of a third-party litigant in any such action, dispute or proceeding in the United States involving the Patent Rights in the Field, Otsuka shall bear the entirety of such adverse judgment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>BMS&#146;s Back-Up Right to Pursue Remedies Against Infringement of the Patent Rights in the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) With respect to any infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of any Patent Rights in the Field in the United
States, if (1)&nbsp;Otsuka decides in writing to BMS not to pursue remedies against the alleged or suspected infringer(s), and (2)&nbsp;in any event if Otsuka fails to commence appropriate action with respect to such infringement within one hundred
twenty (120)&nbsp;days after BMS&#146;s written request to Otsuka to do so, BMS shall have the right, but not the obligation, to take action in its name, or in Otsuka&#146;s name where legally required, and at BMS&#146;s expense, to pursue any and
all remedies against such infringer to stop such infringement and to recover profits and damages. In any such case, Otsuka shall be entitled, at its own expense, to join as a party in pursuing such remedies, if legally permissible. Should
Otsuka&#146;s direct participation in the legal proceedings be indispensable (i.e., it is not legally permissible for BMS to pursue remedies in Otsuka&#146;s name), BMS shall be entitled to request Otsuka, at BMS&#146;s expense, to pursue remedies
(which request Otsuka shall not unreasonably refuse). BMS shall promptly reimburse Otsuka for Otsuka&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not Otsuka&#146;s internal costs) reasonably incurred in so participating. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of determining BMS&#146;s right to pursue remedies under this Subsection
8.2.2(b), in the event of a &#147;Paragraph IV&#148; certification under the Hatch-Waxman Act of 1984, if, by the thirtieth (30th)&nbsp;day following Otsuka&#146;s receipt of the notice required under 21 U.S.C. &#167; 355(j)(2)(B)(i) and (ii),
Otsuka (A)&nbsp;has not commenced a patent infringement suit against the putative infringer as contemplated by the relevant regulations; and (B)&nbsp;has not confirmed to BMS that it intends to do so within forty-five (45)&nbsp;days of the date of
Otsuka&#146;s receipt of such notice, Otsuka shall be deemed to have decided not to pursue remedies within the meaning of Clause (1)&nbsp;above, thereby enabling BMS to pursue remedies under this Subsection 8.2.2(b). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Otsuka shall cooperate with BMS as reasonably requested by BMS in connection with such action, dispute or proceeding commenced by BMS
in accordance with this Subsection 8.2.2(b), shall cause any of Otsuka&#146;s and its Affiliates&#146; employees and agents to give depositions or testify in connection with any proceeding regarding the Patent Rights when requested by BMS, and shall
make available to BMS copies of any and all relevant records, papers, documents, information and specimens. BMS shall promptly reimburse Otsuka for Otsuka&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not Otsuka&#146;s internal costs) reasonably incurred in
providing such cooperation to BMS at BMS&#146;s request, in causing such employees and agents to give such depositions or testimony, and in making available copies of such documents or other materials. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) In all cases where BMS pursues remedies against the infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of the Patent
Rights as permitted in this Subsection 8.2.2(b), except where Otsuka elects, at its expense, to join as a party, BMS shall have the sole and exclusive right to control prosecution of such action, but shall keep Otsuka fully informed on an ongoing
basis with respect to such action, dispute or proceeding and any settlement or compromise discussions, and shall allow Otsuka to participate in the decision-making process with respect thereto. BMS may not settle or compromise any such action,
dispute or proceeding without the prior written consent of Otsuka, which Otsuka shall not unreasonably withhold, In the event of any monetary recovery in connection with such action, dispute or proceeding brought by BMS pursuant to this Subsection
8.2.2(b), or the settlement or compromise thereof, such recovery shall be applied in the following priority: first, to reimburse BMS for its total out-of-pocket expenses reasonably incurred in prosecuting or settling such action, dispute or
proceeding (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys&#146; fees) (&#147;Total Out-of-Pocket Expenses&#148;); second to reimburse Otsuka for its Total Out-of-Pocket Expenses reasonably incurred in connection with such action, to the extent
not previously reimbursed by BMS to Otsuka; and third, the balance to be shared [*] to BMS and [*] to Otsuka. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) In the
event any adverse judgment for monetary liability is imposed on either BMS or Otsuka or both (and/or any of their respective Affiliates) in favor of a third-party litigant in any such action, dispute or proceeding commenced in accordance with this
Subsection 8.2.2(b), BMS shall bear [*] and Otsuka shall bear [*] of such adverse judgment, regardless of the name of the party against which such adverse judgment is imposed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2.3. <U>Remedies Against Infringement of Patent Rights Outside the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>BMS&#146;s First Right to Pursue Remedies Against Infringement of Patent Rights Outside the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) With respect to any infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of any Patent Rights in the Field in the Territory
outside the United States, BMS shall have the first right, but not the obligation, to take action in BMS&#146;s name, or in Otsuka&#146;s name where legally required, and at BMS&#146;s expense, to pursue any and all remedies against such infringer
to stop such infringement and to recover profits and damages in connection therewith. In any such case, Otsuka shall be entitled, at its own expense, to join as a party in pursuing such remedies, if legally permissible. Should Otsuka&#146;s direct
participation in the legal proceedings be indispensable (i.e., it is not legally permissible for BMS to pursue remedies in Otsuka&#146;s name), BMS shall be entitled to request Otsuka, at BMS&#146;s expense, to pursue remedies (which request Otsuka
shall not unreasonably refuse). BMS shall promptly reimburse Otsuka for Otsuka&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not Otsuka&#146;s internal costs) reasonably incurred in so participating. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Otsuka shall cooperate with BMS as reasonably requested by BMS in connection with such action, dispute or proceeding commenced by BMS
in accordance with this Subsection 8.2.3(a), shall cause any of Otsuka&#146;s and its Affiliates&#146; employees and agents to give depositions or testify when requested by BMS, and shall make available to BMS copies of any and all relevant records,
papers, documents, information and specimens. BMS shall promptly reimburse Otsuka for Otsuka&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not Otsuka&#146;s internal costs) reasonably incurred in providing such cooperation to BMS at BMS&#146;s request, in
causing such employees and agents to give depositions or testimony, and in making available copies of such documents or other materials. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) In all cases where BMS pursues remedies against the infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of the Patent Rights as permitted in this Subsection 8.2.3(a), except where Otsuka elects, at
its expense, to join as a party, BMS shall have the sole and exclusive right to control prosecution of such action, but shall keep Otsuka fully informed on an ongoing basis with respect to such action, dispute or proceeding and any related
settlement or compromise discussions, and shall allow Otsuka to participate in the decision making process with respect thereto. BMS may not settle or compromise any such action, dispute or proceeding without the prior written consent of Otsuka,
which Otsuka shall not unreasonably withhold. In the event any monetary recovery in connection with such infringement action, dispute or proceeding, or the settlement or compromise thereof, is obtained, such recovery shall be applied in the
following priority: first, to reimburse BMS for its Total Out-of-Pocket Expenses reasonably incurred in prosecuting or settling such action; second, to reimburse Otsuka for its Total Out-of-Pocket Expenses reasonably incurred in connection with such
action, to the extent not previously reimbursed by BMS to Otsuka; and third, the balance to be shared [*] to BMS and [*] to Otsuka. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) In the event any adverse judgment for monetary liability is imposed on either BMS or
Otsuka or both (and/or any of their respective Affiliates) in favor of a third-party litigant in any such action, dispute or proceeding commenced in accordance with this Subsection 8.2.3(a), BMS shall bear [*] and Otsuka shall bear [*] of such
adverse judgment, regardless of the name of the party against which such adverse judgment is imposed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Otsuka&#146;s
Back-Up Right to Pursue Remedies Against Infringement of Patent Rights Outside the United States</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) With respect to
any infringement, threatened infringement or suspected infringement of any Patent Rights in the Field in the Territory outside the United States, if (1)&nbsp;BMS decides in writing to Otsuka not to pursue remedies against the alleged or suspected
infringer(s), and (2)&nbsp;in any event if BMS fails to commence appropriate action within one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;days after Otsuka&#146;s written request to BMS to do so, Otsuka shall have the right, but not the obligation, to take action in
its name, or in BMS&#146;s name where legally required, and at Otsuka&#146;s expense, to pursue any and all remedies against such infringer to stop such infringement and to recover profits and damages. In any such case, BMS shall be entitled, at its
own expense, to join as a party in pursuing such remedies, if legally permissible. Should BMS&#146;s direct participation in the legal proceedings be indispensable (i.e., it is not legally permissible for Otsuka to pursue remedies in BMS&#146;s
name), Otsuka shall be entitled to request BMS, at Otsuka&#146;s expense, to pursue remedies (which request BMS shall not unreasonably refuse). Otsuka shall promptly reimburse BMS for BMS&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not BMS&#146;s internal
costs) reasonably incurred in so participating. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) BMS shall cooperate with Otsuka as reasonably requested by Otsuka in
connection with such action, dispute or proceeding commenced by Otsuka in accordance with this Subsection 8.2.3(b), shall cause any of BMS&#146;s and its Affiliates&#146; and Sublicensees&#146; employees and agents to give depositions or testify
when requested by Otsuka, and shall make available to Otsuka copies of any and all relevant records, papers, documents, information and specimens. Otsuka shall promptly reimburse BMS on an ongoing basis for BMS&#146;s out-of-pocket expenses (but not
BMS&#146;s internal costs) reasonably incurred in providing such cooperation to Otsuka at Otsuka&#146;s request, in causing such employees and agents to give such depositions or testimony, and in making available copies of such documents or other
materials. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) In all cases where Otsuka pursues remedies against the infringement, threatened infringement or suspected
infringement of the Patent Rights as permitted in this Subsection 8.2.3(b), except where BMS elects, at its expense, to join as a party, Otsuka shall have the sole and exclusive right to control prosecution of such action and the right
(notwithstanding Section&nbsp;8.2.1) to settle and compromise such action, dispute or proceeding without BMS&#146;s consent; provided that (A)&nbsp;Otsuka shall keep BMS fully informed on an ongoing basis with respect to such action, dispute or
proceeding and any related settlement or compromise discussions; and (B)&nbsp;Otsuka may not enter into any Settlement Requiring BMS Consent (as defined above in Section&nbsp;8.2.2(a)(ii)), without the prior written consent of BMS, which BMS shall
not unreasonably withhold. In the event </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">of any monetary recovery in connection with such action, dispute or proceeding brought by Otsuka pursuant to this Subsection 8.2.3(b), or the settlement or
compromise thereof, such recovery shall be applied in the following priority: first, to reimburse Otsuka for its Total Out-of-Pocket Expenses reasonably incurred in prosecuting such action; second, to reimburse BMS for its Total Out-of-Pocket
Expenses reasonably incurred in connection with such action to the extent not previously reimbursed by Otsuka to BMS; and third, the balance to be shared [*] to Otsuka and [*] to BMS. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) In the event any adverse judgment for monetary liability is imposed on either BMS or Otsuka or both (and/or any of their respective
Affiliates) in favor of a third-party litigant in any such action, dispute or proceeding commenced in accordance with this Subsection 8.2.3(b), Otsuka shall bear [*] and BMS shall bear [*] of such judgment, regardless of the name of the party
against which such judgment is imposed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2.4 <U>Certain Disclaimers</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As between BMS and Otsuka (including their respective Affiliates), (a)&nbsp;neither BMS nor Otsuka, as the case may be, shall have or make
any claim or cause of action against the other party in such other party&#146;s capacity as the Active Party, under this Agreement or otherwise, or commence any suit, arbitration or other proceeding against the Active Party, based on, related to or
arising out of (i)&nbsp;the Active Party&#146;s conduct, performance or non-performance in response to any alleged or suspected infringement of the Patent Rights: (ii)&nbsp;the enforcement or non-enforcement of the Patent Rights; (iii)&nbsp;the
pursuit or non-pursuit of remedies in connection therewith or (iv)&nbsp;any action, dispute, litigation or other legal or regulatory proceeding(s) related to any of the matters referred to in (i), (ii)&nbsp;or (iii)&nbsp;above, or the settlement or
compromise of any such action, dispute, litigation or other legal or regulatory proceeding(s); and (b)&nbsp;neither BMS nor Otsuka, as the case may be, in its capacity as the Active Party, shall incur any liability to the other party as a
consequence of any such action, dispute, litigation or other proceeding or any unfavorable decision resulting therefrom (including any decision holding any of the Patent Rights invalid or unenforceable), in each case except only to the extent any
such claim, cause of action, suit, arbitration or other proceeding is based upon the Active Party&#146;s gross negligence or willful misconduct. The foregoing provisions of this Section&nbsp;8.2.4 shall be without prejudice to, and shall not limit,
any obligation on the part of the Active Party to inform, involve or otherwise include the Inactive Party, to obtain the Inactive Party&#146;s approval or consent, or to reimburse or otherwise to pay the Inactive Party, in each case as and to the
extent provided in this Section&nbsp;8.2. For the avoidance of doubt, the Active Party&#146;s discretionary decision whether to pursue or not pursue an alleged or suspected infringer of the Patent Rights, how to pursue such infringer if it elects to
do so, or whether or not to settle or compromise with any such infringer, or on what basis, shall not be a basis upon which the Inactive Party shall be entitled to claim that the Active Party was grossly negligent or engaged in willful misconduct.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, the foregoing provisions of this Section&nbsp;8.2.4 shall, <I>mutatis mutandis, </I>operate to limit any
obligations or liabilities that Otsuka may have to BMS, and any </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">claims or causes of action BMS may have against Otsuka, arising from the reexamination of the Patent Rights or the outcome thereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each of the parties has caused this Amendment No.&nbsp;3 to be executed and delivered by its duly authorized officer as of the day
and year first above written. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<FILENAME>dex1014.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENT NO. 5 TO THE RESTATED DEV. AND COM. COLLABORATION AGMT.
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Amendment No. 5 to the Restated Dev. and Com. Collaboration Agmt.</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.14 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">* CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND
EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AMENDMENT NO. 5 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>TO THE </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>RESTATED DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>COLLABORATION AGREEMENT </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">THIS
AMENDMENT NO.&nbsp;5 (&#147;<B>Amendment</B>&#148;) to that certain Restated Development and Commercialization Collaboration Agreement dated October&nbsp;23, 2001 (&#147;<B>Restated Agreement</B>&#148;), effective as of April&nbsp;4, 2009
(&#147;<B>Amendment Effective Date</B>&#148;), is by and between Otsuka Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (&#147;<B>Otsuka</B>&#148;), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Japan, having a principal place of business at Shinagawa Grand
Central Tower, 2-16-4 Konan, Minato-Ku, Tokyo, 108-8242 Japan, and Bristol-Myers Squibb Company (&#147;<B>BMS</B>&#148;), a corporation organized and existing under the laws of Delaware, having a principal place of business at Route 206 and Province
Line Road, Princeton, New Jersey, 08540, USA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>RECITALS </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Otsuka and BMS have previously entered into the Restated Agreement and an Amendment No.&nbsp;1 (dated March&nbsp;28, 2003), an Amendment
No.&nbsp;2 (dated June&nbsp;5, 2003), an Amendment No.&nbsp;3 (dated September&nbsp;25, 2006) and an Amendment No.&nbsp;4 (dated October&nbsp;31, 2007), to the Restated Agreement (all such amendments, the &#147;<B>Prior Amendments</B>&#148;);
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Otsuka and BMS now desire to further amend and supplement certain terms and conditions of the Restated Agreement (as previously
amended) as hereinafter specified; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">WHEREAS, Otsuka and BMS desire that all other terms and conditions of the Restated Agreement (as
previously amended) remain in full force and effect except to the extent amended by this Amendment; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">NOW, THEREFORE, for good and valuable
consideration, the receipt and adequacy of which are hereby acknowledged, Otsuka and BMS agree as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1. Capitalized terms in this
Amendment shall have the same meaning as those in the Restated Agreement, unless specifically defined otherwise in this Amendment. All Section references are in regard to the Restated Agreement. References to the term &#147;Agreement&#148; in the
Restated Agreement shall be deemed to include the Prior Amendments and this Amendment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2. Except as expressly modified herein, the
Restated Agreement shall remain in full force and effect in accordance with its terms, as previously amended. To the extent that there are any inconsistencies between this Amendment and the Restated Agreement, as previously amended, the terms of
this Amendment shall supersede the Restated Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3. <U>Extension of BMS&#146; Rights and Obligations</U>. In accordance with
Section&nbsp;12.1 of the Restated Agreement, BMS&#146; rights under the Restated Agreement in the United States would (but for this Amendment) expire on the tenth calendar anniversary of the date of First Commercial Sale of Product in the United
States, which is November&nbsp;19, 2012. The Parties hereby agree in this Amendment, on the terms and conditions set forth herein, to amend Section&nbsp;12.1 of the Restated Agreement, as it relates to the term of the Restated </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">* CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE
COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Agreement in the United States, to extend BMS&#146; rights and obligations (which rights and obligations BMS may exercise or perform by or through one or
more of its Affiliates) under the Restated Agreement to develop and Commercialize Product in the United States and to manufacture Product for sale in the United States until April&nbsp;20, 2015, subject to earlier termination in accordance with
Paragraph&nbsp;10 or Paragraph 12 of this Amendment or Section&nbsp;12 of the Restated Agreement. The <B>&#147;U.S. Abilify Extension Term,&#148;</B> as used in this Amendment, means the period commencing on January&nbsp;1, 2010, and ending
April&nbsp;20, 2015; <U>provided</U> that such period may terminate sooner in accordance with Paragraph 10 or Paragraph 12 of this Amendment; <U>provided further</U>, that if the Restated Agreement terminates early in accordance with the provisions
of Section&nbsp;12 of the Restated Agreement, such period shall also terminate upon the date of termination of the Restated Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.
<U>Up-Front Extension Payment</U>. In consideration of Otsuka&#146;s agreement in this Amendment to extend the term of BMS&#146; rights to develop, Commercialize, and manufacture Product for the United States during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term,
BMS (itself or through one or more Affiliate(s) of BMS) shall pay, in the aggregate, an up-front payment of Four Hundred Million U.S. Dollars (U.S. $400,000,000) to Otsuka within five (5)&nbsp;Business Days subsequent to the Amendment Effective Date
of this Amendment. If one or more of BMS&#146; Affiliate(s) shall make such payment to Otsuka, BMS shall so notify Otsuka on or about the Amendment Effective Date and shall identify the Affiliate(s) that shall be making such payment. Such amount is
non-refundable and non-creditable against any other payments due from BMS to Otsuka. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5. <U>Modifications to Otsuka&#146;s and BMS&#146;
Shares of Product Net Sales in the U.S. During the U.S. Abilify Extension Term</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) <U>Background</U>. Under the terms of the Restated
Agreement (as amended) prior to this Amendment, the basic allocation of Net Sales of Product in the United States is sixty-five percent (65%)&nbsp;to BMS and thirty-five percent (35%)&nbsp;to Otsuka, allocated as follows: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) as provided in Section&nbsp;5.9.1(a), Otsuka or an Otsuka Affiliate receives [*] of Net Sales in the United States; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) as provided in Section&nbsp;5.11.2(a)(3), Otsuka or an Otsuka Affiliate pays BMS or a BMS Affiliate [*] of Net Sales in the United
States for finished and packaged Product sold to Otsuka&#146;s Affiliates for sale in the United States (under the BMS-OAPI Product Supply Agreement); and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) as provided in Section&nbsp;5.11.2(a)(1), BMS and its Affiliates pay Otsuka [*] for Compound sold by Otsuka to BMS or BMS&#146; Affiliates (under the Otsuka-BMS Compound Supply Agreement) for formulation into
Product sold in the United States. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The result of these transactions is a split of Net Sales in the United States of sixty-five percent
(65%)&nbsp;to BMS and thirty-five percent (35%)&nbsp;to Otsuka. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) In addition to the foregoing 65/35 split, and in
accordance with Section&nbsp;5.9.2(b) of the Restated Agreement, BMS, through one of its Affiliates, pays Otsuka a royalty equal to an additional [*] on all Net Sales in the United </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">States attributable to or arising from the sale of any and all Product made by BMS or its Affiliates. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Modified Allocation of Net Sales in the United States between Otsuka and BMS During the U.S. Abilify Extension Term</U>. The Parties hereby agree
in this Amendment that, effective January&nbsp;1, 2010, the apportionment of Net Sales in the United States between Otsuka and BMS shall change as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) in calendar year 2010, fifty-eight percent (58%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated to BMS (instead of sixty-five percent (65%))&nbsp;and forty-two percent (42%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the
United States shall be allocated to Otsuka (instead of thirty-five percent (35%)); </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) in calendar year 2011, fifty-three
and one half percent (53.5%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated to BMS and forty-six and one half percent (46.5%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated to Otsuka; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) in calendar year 2012, fifty-one and one half percent (51.5%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated to BMS and
forty-eight and one half percent (48.5%)&nbsp;of Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated to Otsuka; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) in
calendar years 2013 and 2014 and that portion of calendar year 2015 that extends through the end of the U.S. Abilify Extension Term (April 20, 2015), Net Sales in the United States shall be allocated between Otsuka and BMS according to the following
tiering structure, the amount of Net Sales and the allocation thereof between BMS and Otsuka being determined on a calendar year-by-calendar year basis: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) For the avoidance of doubt, and as required by Section&nbsp;5.9.2(b) of the
Restated Agreement, BMS shall continue during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term to pay Otsuka the [*] royalty on all Net Sales in the United States attributable to or arising from the sale of any and all Product made by BMS or its Affiliates, which
amount shall be in addition to Otsuka&#146;s share of Net Sales as provided above. The Parties agree to effect promptly an amendment to the Restated Agreement and/or the applicable manufacturing agreement(s) between Otsuka (or its applicable
Affiliate) and BMS (or its applicable Affiliate) relating to BMS&#146; manufacturing of Product in standard tablet (swallowable) form for Otsuka for sale in the United States to provide that Otsuka does not </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">have the right to terminate such manufacturing rights during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term except in the case of: material breach by BMS; or (as provided
in Section&nbsp;12.4(b) and Section&nbsp;8.4 of the Restated Agreement) [*]; or the Commercialization by BMS (or any of its Affiliates, licensees or sublicensees) of a U.S. Competitive Product (as defined in Paragraph 11(c) below) in violation of
Paragraph 11 of this Amendment; or the early termination of this Amendment or the Restated Agreement in accordance with Paragraph 3 above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">6. <U>Modified Payment Procedures and Purchase Prices in the United States</U>. Section&nbsp;5.9.3 of the Restated Agreement and Appendix&nbsp;G to the Restated Agreement (which appendix is incorporated into the Restated Agreement as
<U>Exhibit&nbsp;1</U> to Amendment No.&nbsp;1) set forth principles and procedures agreed upon by the Parties for collecting, depositing and disbursing Product sales proceeds. Such procedures remain in effect, subject to modification from time to
time by mutual written agreement of the Parties consistent with the agreed principles stated in Section&nbsp;5.9.3. In addition, the Parties shall discuss and amend the purchase prices for Compound and Product set forth in Section&nbsp;5.11.2(a) by
mutual written agreement as they mutually deem appropriate in light of the changed allocations between them of Net Sales in the United States specified above in Paragraph&nbsp;5 of this Amendment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7. <U>Commercial Operations in the United States</U>. BMS and Otsuka hereby agree that, commencing January&nbsp;1, 2010, and for the remainder of the
U.S. Abilify Extension Term, the Parties&#146; specific performance and payment obligations with respect to the advertising, marketing, promotion, sales, distribution of, and provision of medical education for, Product in the United States
(&#147;<B>Commercial Operations</B>&#148;) shall be as set forth in subparagraphs (a)&nbsp;through (i)&nbsp;of this Paragraph 7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)
<U>Definitions</U>. For purposes of this Amendment, the following terms shall have the definitions set forth below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i)
<B>&#147;Operational Expenses&#148;</B> means the following costs and expenses solely to the extent specifically and directly attributable to conducting Commercial Operations with respect to Product in the U.S. during the U.S. Abilify Extension
Term: (i)&nbsp;Commercial Costs; (ii)&nbsp;Distribution Costs; (iii)&nbsp;Medical Education Activities Costs; and (iv)&nbsp;Indirect Costs. For clarity, Operational Expenses shall not include, for example (but without limitation), (1)&nbsp;expenses
related to supply, manufacturing, pharmacovigilance, post-marketing surveillance, or Product recall or (2)&nbsp;any allocation of overhead or general and administrative costs. For clarity, each party will bear its own general and administrative
expenses, except to the extent that such expenses are included in the FTE Rate for MRs and/or MSLs. In addition, any particular cost or expense meeting any of the criteria set forth above to be included in &#147;Operational Expenses&#148; shall be
counted only once in calculating total Operational Expenses for a particular period, notwithstanding that such cost or expense meets or falls within more than one of such criteria. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) <B>&#147;Commercial Costs&#148; </B>means the direct costs that are specifically identifiable to the following sales, marketing and
education activities of the Parties relating to Product in the U.S.: (a)&nbsp;activities directed to the advertising and marketing of such Product; (b)&nbsp;launch meetings; (c)&nbsp;costs of advertising, public relations and medical education
agencies; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) promotional programs and &#147;lunch and learn&#148; meetings; (e)&nbsp;speaker programs, including </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the training of such speakers; (f)&nbsp;development, publication and dissemination of publications relating to such Product; (g)&nbsp;developing, obtaining
and providing training packages of such Product, promotional literature, promotional materials and other selling materials; (h)&nbsp;developing and performing market research; (i)&nbsp;developing information and data specifically intended for
national accounts, managed care organizations and group purchasing organizations, including reimbursement programs; (j)&nbsp;administration, operation and maintenance of the sales representatives (&#147;<B>Medical Representatives</B>&#148; or
&#147;<B>MRs</B>&#148;) that promote Product in the United States, district and regional sales management, home office personnel who support the sales force, all as included in the FTE Rate; (k)&nbsp;conducting Phase IV Clinical Trials on Product in
the U.S.; (l)&nbsp;conducting advisory board meetings or other consultant programs, the purpose of which is to obtain advice and feedback related to the development or commercialization of such Product in the U.S.; and (m)&nbsp;other ancillary
services directly related to the foregoing (to the extent not otherwise falling within subparagraphs 7(a)(ii)(a) through (l)&nbsp;above). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) <B>&#147;Distribution Costs&#148;</B> means, with respect to a Product sold in the United States during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term, all direct internal costs and out of pocket costs incurred by BMS or its
Affiliates in connection with the following activities involved in distribution of such Product to a Third Party: (i)&nbsp;handling and transportation to fulfill orders (excluding such costs, if any, treated as a deduction in the definition of Net
Sales); (ii)&nbsp;customer services, including order entry, billing and adjustments, inquiry and credit and collection; and (iii)&nbsp;direct cost of storage and distribution of the Product. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) <B>&#147;Medical Education Activities Costs&#148;</B> means the direct costs incurred in conducting the following activities designed
to ensure or improve appropriate medical use of, conduct medical education of, or further research regarding, a Product sold in the U.S.: (a)&nbsp;maintaining MSLs (as defined below); and (b)&nbsp;development, publication and dissemination of
publications relating to such Product in the U.S., as well as medical information services provided in response to inquiries communicated via sales representatives or received by letter, phone call or email. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) <B>&#147;Phase IV Clinical Trial&#148;</B> means a product support clinical trial of Product conducted in the United States during the
U.S. Abilify Extension Term. A Phase IV Clinical Trial may include epidemiological studies, modeling and pharmacoeconomic studies, and investigator-sponsored clinical trials studying Product that otherwise fit the foregoing definition. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(vi) <B>&#147;FTE Rate&#148;</B> is as defined on <U>Exhibit 2</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(vii) <B>&#147;Indirect Costs&#148;</B> is as defined on <U>Exhibit 2</U>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) <U>Baseline Commercial Plan</U>. BMS and Otsuka have agreed on baseline annual performance obligations to be fulfilled by the Parties (or their
respective Affiliates) with respect to Commercial Operations in the United States commencing January&nbsp;1, 2010, including the annual number of Medical Representatives and Medical Science Liaisons (&#147;<B>MSLs</B>&#148;) and annual detailing
requirements, and on baseline annual expenses to be incurred by the Parties (or their respective Affiliates) for Commercial Operations in the United States commencing January&nbsp;1, 2010. Such baseline annual performance obligations and baseline
annual operating expenses are set forth in a </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">written plan mutually agreed by the Parties (the &#147;<B>Baseline Commercial Plan</B>&#148;), which plan is attached as <U>Exhibit 1</U> to this Amendment
and is hereby incorporated into the Restated Agreement as <U>Appendix H</U> thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) <U>Annual Commercial Plan</U>. At least three
(3)&nbsp;months prior to January&nbsp;1 of each calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term, commencing prior to calendar year 2010, the JCC (or an Operational Team designated by the JCC) shall consider, modify as it deems appropriate, and
approve by mutual agreement a written plan setting forth the Commercial Operations performance obligations and operating expenses for the upcoming calendar year in the United States (the &#147;<B>Annual Commercial Plan</B>&#148;). It is understood
by the Parties that BMS will continue to perform all Commercial Operations activities, except that Otsuka shall deploy MRs and MSLs (together with BMS, as set forth herein), and shall perform any other Commercial Operations activities agreed by the
JCC (in which case the allocation between the Parties of responsibility for performing a particular item or activity will be set forth in the Annual Commercial Plan). The Annual Commercial Plan shall specify the aggregate number of MRs and MSLs to
be deployed by the Parties in the United States and the total minimum detailing requirements to be fulfilled by the Parties in the United States for the upcoming calendar year (the &#147;<B>Annual Resource Commitment</B>&#148;) and shall include a
detailed budget for the operating expenses to be incurred by the Parties (in the aggregate, and also broken down to specific budgets for the individual categories of Commercial Operations covered by the Annual Commercial Plan) in connection with
Commercial Operations in the United States for the upcoming calendar year (the &#147;<B>Annual Commercial Expense Budget</B>&#148;). For clarity, each Annual Commercial Plan (and any amendment or modification to any Annual Commercial Plan or any
part thereof), including the allocation of responsibilities between the Parties with respect to Commercial Operations activities, must be approved by mutual agreement of the JCC (with neither Party having a tie-breaking vote with regard to approval
of any Annual Commercial Plan). If the JCC is unable to agree upon and approve the Annual Commercial Plan for any calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term, then the Baseline Commercial Plan attached as <U>Exhibit 1</U> to this Amendment
shall govern the Parties&#146; obligations and the total expense budget with respect to Commercial Operations in the United States for such year, and the aggregate number of MRs and MSLs to be deployed by the Parties in the United States and the
total detailing requirements to be fulfilled by the Parties in the United States set forth in the Baseline Commercial Plan shall be deemed to be the Annual Resource Commitment for such calendar year, and the aggregate expense budget set forth in the
Baseline Commercial Plan shall be deemed to be the Annual Commercial Expense Budget for such year. From time to time during any such calendar year, the JCC may agree to modify or amend the Annual Resource Commitment and/or the Commercial Expense
Budget for such year. Notwithstanding Section&nbsp;5.1.2 of the Restated Agreement (as amended by this Amendment), neither the BMS Chair nor the Otsuka Chair of the JCC shall have the tie-breaking vote with respect to establishing any Annual
Commercial Plan or modifying any Annual Resource Commitment or Commercial Expense Budget, which must be mutually agreed to by Otsuka&#146;s Chair and BMS&#146; Chair on the JCC. For the avoidance of doubt, the JCC shall continue to have final
authority and responsibility for development of the Marketing Plans in accordance with Section&nbsp;5.2 of the Restated Agreement, and each Annual Commercial Plan and the Baseline Commercial Plan shall form part of the Marketing Plans for the United
States; <U>provided</U> that, in the event of any inconsistency between the terms of any Marketing Plan and the terms of the Baseline Commercial Plan or any Annual Commercial Plan, the terms of the Baseline Commercial Plan or Annual Commercial Plan
(as the case may be) shall govern. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) <U>Otsuka Promotional Efforts</U>. Without limiting its right under Paragraph 7(g) to contribute
additional resources (at its expense), Otsuka (or its Affiliate) shall have the right during the period commencing January&nbsp;1, 2010, and ending June&nbsp;30, 2014, to deploy [*] MRs and [*]MSLs in the United States in each such year, with the
FTE Rates and Indirect Costs (as provided in <U>Exhibit 2</U> to this Amendment) associated with such MRs and MSLs being allocable between the Parties as Operational Expenses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the time the JCC considers the Annual Commercial Plan for each calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term, and in any event at least six (6)&nbsp;months prior to January&nbsp;1 of each year during the
U.S. Abilify Extension Term, Otsuka shall determine in its discretion, and shall inform BMS of, the number of MRs and MSLs (up to the maximum numbers set forth above in this subparagraph (d)) that Otsuka (or its Affiliate) shall deploy during the
upcoming calendar year. The actual number of MRs and MSLs and details that Otsuka commits to deploy in a particular calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term is referred to in this Amendment as Otsuka&#146;s &#147;<B>Required Resource
Commitment</B>&#148; for such year. In each calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term, Otsuka shall fulfill its Required Resource Commitment for such year, and BMS shall fulfill the balance of the Annual Resource Commitment for such year,
which shall be the difference between such Annual Resource Commitment and Otsuka&#146;s Required Resource Commitment for the year (such remainder being BMS&#146; &#147;<B>Required Resource Commitment</B>&#148; for such year). Each Party&#146;s
Required Resource Commitment for each calendar year during the U.S. Abilify Extension Term shall be set forth in the Annual Commercial Plan for such calendar year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">As provided in greater detail in <U>Exhibit 3</U> to this Amendment, each Party&#146;s MRs shall be assigned an equitable share of valuable, productive accounts and an equitable share of responsibility for opinion leaders, large accounts
and other more desirable accounts and prescribers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The JCC shall consult in good faith regarding, and shall mutually determine (with neither Party having
a tie-breaking vote), a reasonable plan and budget, with a duration of no more than ninety (90)&nbsp;days (the &#147;[*]<B> Plan</B>&#148;), for the [*] pursuant to this subparagraph (d). The [*] Plan shall also plan for [*]. In making [*] during
such transition, the Parties acknowledge that such transition will involve disruption of [*] with respect to Product, but they shall work cooperatively to minimize such disruption and to achieve an efficient and cost-effective transition, and in
manner consistent with the ultimate achievement of the above-described equitable allocation of responsibility.&nbsp;The [*] Plan shall be deemed to be an amendment to the applicable Annual Commercial Plan, including the associated Annual Commercial
Expense Budget.&nbsp;The Parties acknowledge that such agreed transition arrangements may result in the inclusion in such Annual Commercial Plan and Annual Commercial Expense Budget, and the charging by either or both Parties of, Operational
Expenses for [*] with respect to the Product, during the limited period of such transition, than would otherwise have been the case had Otsuka not exercised its right to deploy MRs pursuant to this subparagraph (d). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e) <U>Co-Promotion Agreement</U>. In furtherance of the terms and conditions set forth in this Paragraph 7, the Parties shall enter into a co-promotion
agreement (the <B>&#147;Co-Promotion Agreement&#148;</B>) to be negotiated in good faith by the Parties and entered into within one hundred </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">twenty (120)&nbsp;days subsequent to the Amendment Effective Date. The Co-Promotion Agreement will include the specific terms set forth in <U>Exhibit 3</U>
to this Amendment, along with additional commercially reasonable terms and conditions customary in the industry for an agreement of this type. In the event of any inconsistency between the terms of this Amendment and the terms of the Co-Promotion
Agreement, the terms of this Amendment shall prevail (unless the Co-Promotion Agreement specifically states otherwise). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) <U>Allocation
and Payment of Operational Expenses</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) Each Annual Commercial Expense Budget shall itemize the Operational Expenses
to be incurred by the Parties in the applicable calendar year, in a detailed manner with respect to each different category of Commercial Operations, including (without limitation) costs of Product-related sales and promotional literature, materials
and supplies, costs of advertisements and press materials, costs of educational symposia, conferences and programs, and the cumulative cost of both Parties&#146; direct expenses for MRs and MSLs (on an FTE basis) budgeted to be incurred in
fulfilling each Party&#146;s Required Resource Commitment in the calendar year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) It is understood and agreed by the
Parties that (A)&nbsp;all costs associated with the Parties&#146; MRs and MSLs are included in the FTE Rates and Indirect Costs set forth on <U>Exhibit 2</U>, and (B)&nbsp;costs associated with Otsuka&#146;s employees other than MRs and MSLs shall
be included in Commercial Operational Expenses only if and to the extent such other Otsuka employees will be performing Commercial Operation activities as provided in any Annual Commercial Plan or as otherwise agreed by the JCC. For clarity, each
Party shall bear its own costs of recruiting, relocation and severance relating to MRs and MSLs, and such costs shall not be included in the FTE Rate for MRs or MSLs or Commercial Operational Expenses. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) Each Party shall provide bonuses and/or other incentive compensation to its MRs so as to encourage appropriate maximization of
Product sales. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) During each calendar year commencing January&nbsp;1, 2010, and ending December&nbsp;31, 2012, Otsuka
shall pay thirty percent (30%)&nbsp;and BMS shall pay seventy percent (70%)&nbsp;of the total annual Operational Expenses incurred by the Parties in the United States during the applicable year up to, but not exceeding (except as approved by the
JCC, with neither Party having the tie-breaking vote), the total amount set forth in the Annual Commercial Expense Budget for the applicable calendar year (as such budget may be amended by the Sales Force Transition Plan described in subparagraph
(d)&nbsp;above), regardless of whether Otsuka&#146;s Required Resource Commitment in a given calendar year is greater or less than thirty percent (30%)&nbsp;of the Annual Resource Commitment in such year. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) During each calendar year commencing January&nbsp;1, 2013, and ending on the expiration or termination of the U.S. Abilify Extension
Term, Otsuka and BMS shall each pay fifty percent (50%)&nbsp;of the total annual Operational Expenses incurred by the Parties in the United States for the applicable calendar year up to, but not exceeding (except as approved by the JCC, with neither
Party having the tie-breaking vote), the total amount set forth in the Annual Commercial Expense Budget during the applicable calendar year (as such budget may be amended by the Sales Force Transition Plan described in subparagraph (d)&nbsp;above),
regardless of whether Otsuka&#146;s Required Resource Commitment in a given calendar </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT REQUESTED. CONFIDENTIAL PORTION HAS BEEN FILED SEPARATELY WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">year is greater or less than fifty percent (50%)&nbsp;of the Annual Resource Commitment in such year. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) <U>Additional Expenses</U>. Either Party may, in its discretion, contribute more than its Required Resource Commitment in any calendar year (i.e.,
either BMS or Otsuka may deploy </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">more MRs and/or may increase its detailing of Product over and above the obligations set forth in the Annual Commercial
Plan (or Baseline Commercial Plan, as the case may be)), and either Party may invest in or conduct additional Commercialization activities that are not included in the applicable Annual Commercial Plan and thus incur associated Operational Expenses
in excess of the applicable Annual Commercial Expense Budget (as set forth in subparagraph (c)&nbsp;above) (&#147;<B>Additional Expenses</B>&#148;), provided that the JCC reviews and approves such activities and associated Additional Expenses in
order to facilitate appropriate coordination of sales calls and consistency with the overall marketing effort of the then-current Marketing Plan (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Additional Expenses incurred by a Party in a
calendar year shall be borne one hundred percent (100%)&nbsp;by such Party. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(h) <U>Cost Overruns or Reallocations</U>. If a Party
anticipates that, in conducting Commercial Operations activities in the United States, it shall incur Operational Expenses that are in excess of [*] over the amount budgeted for a particular category in the Annual Commercial Expense Budget (i.e.,
the Patient, Payor, or Professional category), or where a shift in expenses from one such category to another would result in a reallocation between such categories of over [*] in the applicable Annual Commercial Expense Budget, then such Party
shall inform the other Party of such anticipated cost overrun or reallocation as soon as possible, and the JCC will meet and discuss the causes of such overrun or reallocation and whether to modify the Annual Commercial Expense Budget to address
such possible overrun or reallocation, including the re-allocation of certain expenses in such Annual Commercial Expense Budget from other activities to the activity that is the subject of any such excess, but in any case, with the goal of keeping
the aggregate Annual Commercial Expense Budget unchanged (unless the Parties otherwise agree). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) <U>Payment of Operational Expenses</U>.
Following the Amendment Effective Date, the Parties shall discuss and agree upon reasonable procedures for paying, reimbursing and/or reconciling the Operational Expenses to be incurred and paid by each Party according to the above subparagraphs of
this Paragraph 7, which procedures are intended to ensure that each Party will incur and bear its appropriate allocation (as set forth in subparagraph (f)&nbsp;above) of the Annual Commercial Expense Budget for the particular calendar year. Such
procedures shall be subject to modification from time to time by mutual written agreement of Otsuka and BMS, as needed or appropriate to ensure accurate and efficient sharing of the Operational Expenses incurred in accordance with the terms of this
Paragraph 7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(j) <U>Amendment of Restated Agreement</U>. The following provisions of the Restated Agreement are hereby amended to the
extent necessary to give effect to subparagraphs (a)&nbsp;through (i)&nbsp;above and Exhibit 3: Section&nbsp;5.2 (Marketing Plans); Section&nbsp;5.3.1(d) (references to BMS&#146; sole cost); Section&nbsp;5.3.2(b) (references to BMS&#146;
obligations, at its sole cost, to prepare advertising and promotional materials and implement marketing and promotional activities and strategies); Section&nbsp;5.3.3(a) (second sentence); Section&nbsp;5.3.4 (first paragraph and subsections (a),
(b), (e)&nbsp;&#150; (g)&nbsp;as such subsections pertain to reimbursement of Otsuka&#146;s direct expenses incurred in the United States); Section&nbsp;5.3.5 (Sales Team Assignments) (the sixth, seventh, eighth and ninth </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*
